output.dependency: The values in the third column, which represent flight codes, determine the meaning of the values in the fourth column, which represent departure times.
The values in the third column, which represent flight codes, also determine the meaning of the values in the fifth column, which represent arrival times.
The values in the third column, which represent the same flight code, maintain a consistent arrival time across all records in the dataset.
The second column represents sources or providers of flight information and is consistently associated with the same flight code present in the third column.
The fourth column, indicating departure times, has a syntactic relationship with the fifth column, indicating arrival times, as both sets of times are associated with the same flight.
The values in the fifth column, which indicate arrival times, are connected to those in the sixth column, which consistently indicate a set time of events occurring related to those flights.
